intro: Hermannia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are rounded and glossy, often arranged in pairs along the stem. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
